annotations.description: It was an attractive offensive game and the fans have no reason to be upset. The home side dominated the game. The tactic of the home side was slow build up play, while the away side gave the opposition a hard time by closing them down quickly and aggressively.

annotations.label: whistle

The players claim that Alvaro Arbeloa (Real Madrid) handled the ball and it seems they are right. A free kick is awarded to Las Palmas.
Jonathan Viera (UD Las Palmas) tries his luck from a long range free kick and fires the ball to the right side of the goal, but Keylor Navas is alert and thwarts the effort.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Casemiro (Real Madrid) outjumps the defence inside the six yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the left side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:2.

annotations.description: Jese (Real Madrid) steps up to send the ball in.

annotations.description: Figueroa Cabrera Momo plays a neat ball into the path of Da Silva Willian Jose (UD Las Palmas), who makes room for a shot and fires the ball into the back of the net! 0:1.

Long passes, short passes and one two passes. Real Madrid are showcasing great team work by keeping possession and producing pin point passes from player to player. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult to intercept at the moment.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Gareth Bale will be replaced by Jese (Real Madrid).
Great teamplay by Las Palmas as they control the ball with a lot of short passes. Patience is the key if they want to find a gap in the defence to score.

annotations.description: The attendance for today's match is 25846.
Pedro Bigas (UD Las Palmas) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post.

annotations.description: Las Palmas earn a corner.

What a chance! annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Jonathan Viera (UD Las Palmas).
Las Palmas are all set to take the indirect free kick from inside the box. These situations are quite rare and everyone is curious what they are going to do with it.

annotations.description: That's the end of the game for Nili, who is replaced by Nabil El Zhar (UD Las Palmas).
Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) collects a pass and has an effort from 20 metres out, but it flies just wide of the right post.

Great touch by Nili (UD Las Palmas) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) whips the ball in, but it fails to reach any of his teammates as the opposition's defence averts the threat.
Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid range, but the effort is well wide of the right post.
Pepe (Real Madrid) will miss the next game.

annotations.label: whistle

We have seen an attractive offensive game so far and the fans have nothing to complain about. Neither team was able to take the initiative and dominate the first half. The home side attempts to hold onto the ball for as long as possible. The away team is applying strong pressure, leaving the opponent little space for combination play.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Daniel Carvajal (Real Madrid) passes the ball onto Cristiano Ronaldo, but one of the defenders dispossesses him.
Sergio Ramos (Real Madrid) fires the ball at goal from inside the area, but it's well blocked.
Javier Garrido (UD Las Palmas) is penalised for holding. David Fernandez Borbalan signals a set piece.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Angel Montoro (UD Las Palmas) was quite harsh and David Fernandez Borbalan didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Nili (UD Las Palmas) escapes without any punishment from the referee after using excessive force to foul his opponent.
Lucas (Real Madrid) was too forceful with his tackle and David Fernandez Borbalan interrupted the game to signal a free kick.
Lucas (Real Madrid) is picked out by his teammate with a brilliant short pass, but it takes him too long to control the ball inside the box and this allows one of the defending players to rob him.

annotations.description: Isco (Real Madrid) fails to produce a decent cross from the corner kick. The ball goes well out of play.

Isco (Real Madrid) misses a good chance to score. An inch perfect cross into the box finds Isco (Real Madrid) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Real Madrid have been awarded a corner kick.
Pedro Bigas (UD Las Palmas) gets to the ball from the resulting corner but blazes it well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Real Madrid will have a goal kick.

Da Silva Willian Jose (UD Las Palmas) latches on to a through ball inside the box, but one of the defenders steps in with a timely interception. It could have been a great chance otherwise. The ball goes out of play and Las Palmas have been awarded a corner kick.
Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) timed his run perfectly to connect with the resulting corner kick, but his finish from around the penalty spot was rather poor as it went well wide of the right post.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Isco (Real Madrid) goes over to take the corner kick and it looks like he will send the ball into the penalty box.

Las Palmas slow the tempo of the game down by exchanging a combination of one or two touch passes. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult at the moment, very physically demanding to run without the ball.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Sergio Ramos (Real Madrid) jumps highest inside the box to meet the resulting corner from Isco. His well placed header ends up in the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. 0:1.

Sergio Ramos (Real Madrid) finds himself beyond the last defender, but the game is stopped by the referee after the linesman signals for offside.

Welcome to our minute by minute commentary of today's clash. You can enjoy a written form of everything important that will be happening on the pitch. Have fun.

It was an attractive offensive game and the fans have no reason to be upset. The home side dominated the game. The tactic of the home side was slow build up play, while the away side gave the opposition a hard time by closing them down quickly and aggressively.
